channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Live Updates: Blinken Urges Netanyahu to Seek Truces in Gaza and Lebanon
item.description: The U.S. secretary of state, visiting Israel, said the killing of Hamas’s leader could create an opening for peace, and he pushed the Israeli prime mi...

item.title: FBI Is Investigating a Leak That Appears to Show Israel's Plan to Attack Iran
item.description: The documents began circulating on Friday on the Telegram app, and U.S. officials are looking for the original source of the leak.

item.title: U.S. Charges Iranian Revolutionary Guards Official in Assassination Plot
item.description: The failed plot to kill Masih Alinejad, a human-rights activist, has already led to murder-for-hire charges against members of an Eastern European cri...

item.title: Kamala Harris’s Early Career Involved Courtrooms and the Social Elite
item.description: As Kamala Harris toiled as a junior prosecutor in Alameda County, Calif., she developed important connections among San Francisco’s financial and soci...

item.title: Latest listeria recall yanks frozen waffles from store shelves
item.description: TreeHouse Foods announces dozens of items being recalled.

item.title: FBI Is Investigating a Leak That Appears to Show Israel's Plan to Attack Iran
item.description: The documents began circulating on Friday on the Telegram app, and U.S. officials are looking for the original source of the leak.

item.title: Putin Welcomes Xi and Other World Leaders to Russia for BRICS Summit
item.description: The Russian leader wants cast himself as a global statesman even as the U.S. and its Western allies try to isolate him.

item.title: Exclusive: DeFi platform Azura launches after raising $6.9 million from Initialized
item.description: 21-year-old founder Jackson Denka says Azura will “let anyone trade anything from anywhere.”

item.title: Tesla is having a rough year—this week’s earnings may provide more of the same
item.description: The lack of clarity about the company’s short-term strategy may be weighing on the stock, which is down 13% this year.

item.title: Vatican and China Extend Agreement on Catholic Bishops
item.description: Critics argue the pact legitimizes China’s control over church affairs, while defenders say it helps support Catholics faithful to the Vatican in the ...

item.title: HSBC names Pam Kaur as first female CFO in bank’s history
item.description: The 60-year-old brings a long focus on auditing, risks and compliance across almost four decades of banking career spanning various global lenders.

item.title: Yellen says world was ‘worse off’ under Trump-era isolationism
item.description: Yellen opened the IMF and World Bank annual meetings by highlighting U.S. economic growth since the nation was in the grips of the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: Why New York’s Orthodox Jewish Voters Could Tip the Battle for the House
item.description: In three key swing districts in New York’s Hudson Valley, candidates are pressing for the support of ultra-Orthodox Jews, who tend to vote as a bloc.

item.title: I.M.F. Says Inflation Fight Is Largely Over but Warns of New Threats
item.description: The International Monetary Fund said protectionism and new trade wars could weigh on growth.
